sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using QR decomposition
message_1:
Solve the following system of linear equations using QR decomposition:

3x + 2y + z = 10
2x - y + 3z = 5
x + 3y - 2z = 6

Round your answer to two decimal places.
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using QR decomposition, we first need to represent the system in matrix form Ax = b, where A is the matrix of coefficients, x is the column vector of variables, and b is the column vector of constants.

A = | 3  2  1 |
    | 2 -1  3 |
    | 1  3 -2 |

b = | 10 |
    |  5 |
    |  6 |

Now, we need to perform QR decomposition on matrix A. QR decomposition is a method to decompose a matrix A into an orthogonal matrix Q and an upper triangular matrix R such that A = QR.

Using the Gram-Schmidt process, we can find the orthogonal matrix Q and upper triangular matrix R.

1. Calculate the first column of Q (q1):
u1 = a1 = (3, 2, 1)
q1 = u1 / ||u1|| = (3, 2, 1) / sqrt(14) = (3/sqrt(14), 2/sqrt(14), 1/sqrt(14))

2. Calculate the second column of Q (q2):
u2 = a2 - (a2·q1)q1
u2 = (2, -1, 3) - ( (2, -1, 3)·(3/sqrt(14), 2/sqrt(14), 1/sqrt(14)) ) (3/sqrt(14), 2/sqrt(14), 1/sqrt(14))
u2 = (2, -1, 3) - (4/sqrt(14))(3/sqrt(14), 2/sqrt(14), 1/sqrt(14))
u2 = (2, -1, 3) - (12/14, 8/14, 4/14)
u2 = (-2/7, -9/7, 17/7)
q2 = u2 / ||u2|| = (-2/7, -9/7, 17/7) / sqrt(338/49) = (-2/sqrt(338), -9/sqrt(338), 17/sqrt(338))

3. Calculate the third column of Q (q3):
u3 = a3 - (a3·q1)q1 - (a3·q2)q2
u3 = (1, 3, -2) - ( (1, 3, -2)·(3/sqrt(14), 2/sqrt(14), 1/sqrt(14)) ) (3/sqrt(14), 2/sqrt(14), 1/sqrt(14)) - ( (1, 3, -2)·(-2/sqrt(338), -9/sqrt(338), 17/sqrt(338)) ) (-2/sqrt(338), -9/sqrt(338), 17/sqrt(338))
u3 = (1, 3, -2) - (1/sqrt(14))(3/sqrt(14), 2/sqrt(14), 1/sqrt(14)) - (1/sqrt(338))(-2/sqrt(338), -9/sqrt(338), 17/sqrt(338))
u3 = (1, 3, -2) - (3/14, 2/14, 1/14) - (-2/338, -9/338, 17/338)
u3 = (5/14, 43/14, -25/14)
q3 = u3 / ||u3|| = (5/14, 43/14, -25/14) / sqrt(2555/196) = (5/sqrt(2555), 43/sqrt(2555), -25/sqrt(2555))

Now we have the orthogonal matrix Q:
Q = |  3/sqrt(14)  -2/sqrt(338)   5/sqrt(2555)  |
    |  2/sqrt(14)  -9/sqrt(338)  43/sqrt(2555)  |
    |  1/sqrt(14)  17/sqrt(338) -25/sqrt(2555)  |

Next, we find the upper triangular matrix R:
R = Q^T * A

R = |  sqrt(14)  -4/sqrt(14)  1/sqrt(14)  |
    |    0       sqrt(338)   1/sqrt(338) |
    |    0         0        sqrt(2555)   |

Now we have the QR decomposition of A:
A = QR

We can now solve the system Rx = Q^T * b.

1. Calculate Q^T * b:
Q^T * b = |  3/sqrt(14)   2/sqrt(14)   1/sqrt(14)  | | 10 |
          | -2/sqrt(338) -9/sqrt(338) 17/sqrt(338) | |  5 |
          |  5/sqrt(2555) 43/sqrt(2555) -25/sqrt(2555) | |  6 |

Q^T * b = |  20/sqrt(14)  |
          | -15/sqrt(338) |
          |  45/sqrt(2555) |

2. Solve the system Rx = Q^T * b using back-substitution:
R = |  sqrt(14)  -4/sqrt(14)  1/sqrt(14)  | x = |  20/sqrt(14)  |
    |    0       sqrt(338)   1/sqrt(338) |     | -15/sqrt(338) |
    |    0         0        sqrt(2555)   |     |  45/sqrt(2555) |

From the third row of R, we have:
sqrt(2555) * z = 45/sqrt(2555)
z = 45/2555

From the second row of R, we have:
sqrt(338) * y + (1/sqrt(338)) * z = -15/sqrt(338)
y = -15/338 - (1/338) * (45/2555)
y = -15/338 - 45/862690

From the first row of R, we have:
sqrt(14) * x - (4/sqrt(14)) * y + (1/sqrt(14)) * z = 20/sqrt(14)
x = 20/14 + (4/14) * (-15/338 - 45/862690) - (1/14) * (45/2555)
x = 20/14 - 60/4717 - 45/35770

Now, we round the values of x, y, and z to two decimal places:

x ≈ 1.43
y ≈ -0.04
z ≈ 0.02

So, the solution to the system of linear equations is approximately x = 1.43, y = -0.04, and z = 0.02.
